context: A suspected DCSync attack (replication of directory services) involving Julian Burke, IT director, was observed on host VNEVADO-Win10V. This event is part of a multi-stage incident where Ethan Brooks, an Account Executive, conducted user and IP address reconnaissance via SMB sessions on the same device, VNEVADO-Win10V, targeting VNEVADO-DC. Further investigation revealed that a user accessed a link in an email that was quarantined by zero-hour auto purge (ZAP). This alert was triggered based on a Microsoft Defender for Office 365 alert.
question: What URL did the user access that was found in a ZAP-quarantined email?
solution_steps: Julian Burke (IT director) on host `VNEVADO-Win10V` sent a replication request to host `VNEVADO-DC` which is suspected to be a DCSync attack.

Ethan Brooks (Account Executive) with SID `S-5-7-21-1843151660-3234030288-105586167-1422` on host `VNEVADO-Win10V` enumerated SMB sessions on `VNEVADO-DC`, retrieving recent IP addresses of 2 accounts.
A user accessed the URL `https://ac27145722.livelygrass-8d4c4013.eastus2.azurecontainerapps.io/` in an email that was quarantined by zero-hour auto purge (ZAP).
